item.title: 3D crystal models and 3D structures
item.description:
This project aims to design 3D models of crystal models and mineral structures that can be visualised on the computer or printed with a 3D printer. All these models can be consulted in the following links:

3D crystal models and structures

Modelos cristalográficos y estructuras en 3D (In Spanish)

Or on my thingiverse page

This project has been made possible thanks to the funding received through the teaching innovation projects of the Universidad Complutense de Madrid (PI: Carlos M. Pina).

An example of a calcite 3D model

item.title: Non-existent minerals
item.description:
This project, in collaboration with Carlos M. Pina, focuses on disseminating different scientific concepts, with special emphasis on mineralogy, based on the minerals that appear in science fiction and fantasy films, books, comics and video games.

Thanks to this project, we have published two books, held several exhibitions and given numerous talks. For a comprehensive list of these activities see dissemination.

item.title: Photogrammetry models
item.description:
This project was started with the idea of obtaining 3D models of the chemical gardens that I obtained in the laboratory in order to have an overview of the garden after destroying it for analysis. The first thing I realised when using photogrammetry was that it was a more complex technique than I expected, so I had to start with natural models that were simpler and bigger than the chemical gardens. As a sample some of the first models I made.

Backbone 3D model

Menilite 3D model

item.title: Prize-giving ceremony of the 'Inventa un mineral' competition
item.description: The prizes of the first “Inventa un mineral” competition will be awarded during the presentation of the Pequeña guía de minerales inexistentes. Volumen II, which will take place at the Geominero Museum in Madrid on 15 December 2021 at 18.00. During the awards ceremony, the winners will also have the opportunity to present the minerals they have created.

item.title: 'Inventa un mineral' competition
item.description:
Universidad Complutense de Madrid, through its Vice-Rectorate for Culture, Sport and University Extension (Ediciones Complutense), on the occasion of the publication of the book Pequeña guía de minerales inexistentes. Volumen II, and with the aim of promoting artistic and scientific creation, announces the first “Inventa un mineral” competition. (Only for people living in Spain)

The competition terms can be consulted at the following link: https://eventos.ucm.es/72810/detail
